results.title: Huckleberry Finn
results.brief_description: Mark Twain’s immortal classic “Huckleberry Finn” is vividly portrayed in this adventurous account of a boy living on the shores of the Mississippi River. The wild adventures begin when Huck Finn and Jim join forces and set off on a raft down the treacherous Mississippi River, where they risk life and limb in dangerous and breathtaking encounters with slave hunters, con artists and robbers. Stars Ron Howard and Donny Most. Rated: G

results.title: The Neverending Story
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Petersen, Bernard Eichinger and Dieter Geissler
results.brief_description: A young boy escapes the neighbourhood bullies by retreating into a mysterious book that takes him into a shimmering fantasy world of creatures, giant forests and massive oceans. It is an awesome world, but a world in decay, and its existence is being threatened. Rated: G

results.title: The Slipper and the Rose
results.brief_description: This is a captivating and enchanting musical version of the world’s best loved and most often told fairy-tale romance - Cinderella. The legendary appeal of this fairy-tale is captured on the night of the Palace Ball when Cinderella makes her breathtaking entrance. The Prince is entranced, but already it is midnight and Cinderella must vanish into the darkness, leaving behind only a tiny glass slipper.

results.title: Man of letters (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Professor Dorton Serry, played by Warren Mitchell, is a Man of letters. An esteemed philosopher and lover of all women, he controls his world absolutely. So how does he react when the women in his life step out of their allotted roles and challenge his prejudices and philosophy of life? Adapted from the novel by Glen Tomasetti.

results.title: Blood of a poet = Le Sang d'un poete
results.brief_description: This film depicts the metaphorical adventures of a poet and is composed of four episodes: “The Wounded hand or the scars of the poet”; “Do walls have ears”; “The Snow ball fight”; “The Profanation of the host”. The movie has an avant-garde roughness and unpredictability in its construction and use ofsymbols, but it is fundamentally a very characteristic, neo-Romantic study of the joy and agonies of being an artist. It remains extremely interesting and a source of Cocteau’s later work. In French dialogue only - no English subtitles.

results.title: Avant-garde
results.creator_credit: Jean Vigo, Luis Bunuel, Rene Clair and Salvador Dali
results.brief_description: A collection of three classic, silent avant-garde films. Bunuel and Dali’s surrealist nightmare “Un Chien Andalou” (1929) which caused a riot at its Paris premiere. Rene Clair’s dada-surrealist classic “Entr’acte” (1924) in which inanimate objects start to have a will of their own. Made in collaboration with Man Ray, Marcel Duchamp and Francis Picarbia. Jean Vigos’ “A Propos de Nice” which is a fascinating study in contrasts between the tourists and sunseekers of the wealthy section of Nice and the toilers of the poor sections of the old town. A carnival in the latter part of the film emerges as a kind of dance of death.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Vigo, Luis Bunuel, Rene Clair and Salvador Dali

results.title: Two Friends
results.brief_description: A film about the troubled middle teenage years of two school girls, exploring the change in their relationship over a year. Louise and Kelly were good friends but as the year progresses, the two girls grow apart. The story is told in five separate periods over the year. It begins in the present and ends in the past. Written by Helen Garner.

results.title: Yellow earth
results.brief_description: Despite several decades of communist rule in China, the peasantry in many places and in many ways remained nearly as backward and poor as before “liberation.” This drama is about a young girl from a poor family, trapped and trying to escape from that way of life and an arranged marriage. One of the most important films of the Chinese new wave. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Dersu Uzala
results.brief_description: A fascinating epic by veteran Japanese director, Kurosawa, about the struggle of hardy souls to chart the wilderness of Siberia around 1900. Remarkable photography and the performance of Munzuk as an old native hunter carry the film. Drawn from the autobiographical novels of a military explorer.
